renee-good.title: Renee Good Case
renee-good.summary: U.S. citizen and mother of three shot by ICE agent in Minneapolis. Video contradicts official claims. Federal authorities blocking state investigation.
renee-good.background: On January 7, 2026, ICE Agent Jonathan Ross fatally shot Renee Nicole Good, a 37-year-old U.S. citizen, poet, and mother of three, on a Minneapolis street after she had dropped her 6-year-old son at school. Multiple videos show Good was not a threat—she smiled and said 'I'm not mad at you' moments before Ross fired three shots, first into her windshield and then through her open window. Video shows Ross was standing out of the vehicle's path when he opened fire. DHS Secretary Kristi Noem called it 'domestic terrorism.' Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey called that claim 'bullshit.' Governor Walz proclaimed January 9 'Renee Good Day.' Federal authorities reversed an agreement with Minnesota BCA and seized exclusive jurisdiction, blocking state investigators from all evidence.

dhs-oig.subject: Complaint: False Statements, Excessive Force, and Obstruction - Renee Good Shooting
allegations: UNJUSTIFIED USE OF DEADLY FORCE: ICE Agent Jonathan Ross shot Renee Nicole Good, a U.S. citizen, three times. Multiple videos show she posed no threat—Ross was standing out of her vehicle's path when he fired. She had smiled and said 'I'm not mad at you' moments before being killed.

FALSE PUBLIC STATEMENTS: DHS Secretary Kristi Noem falsely characterized Good as engaged in 'domestic terrorism' and claimed the agent acted in self-defense because Good tried to run him over. Video evidence directly contradicts this—Minneapolis Mayor Frey called it 'bullshit.'

OBSTRUCTION OF JUSTICE: Federal authorities reversed an agreement with Minnesota BCA for joint investigation, seized all evidence, and are blocking state investigators from accessing case materials, scene evidence, or investigative interviews.
EVIDENCE SUPPRESSION: Agent Ross's cellphone video, his firearm, ammunition casings, and Good's vehicle are being withheld from state authorities who have jurisdiction to investigate.
ABUSE OF AUTHORITY: Federal immunity claims appear designed to shield Agent Ross from state prosecution and accountability.
actions: Investigate Agent Jonathan Ross's use of deadly force
Investigate Secretary Noem's false public statements
Investigate the decision to block state investigators
Investigate whether evidence is being suppressed or destroyed
Preserve all video footage, including Agent Ross's cellphone video
Refer criminal conduct to appropriate authorities

IMPROPER IMMUNITY CLAIMS: Vice President Vance claimed federal agents have immunity from state prosecution. Minnesota AG Keith Ellison called this a 'misstatement of the law.'
COORDINATION TO OBSTRUCT: Communications between DOJ, DHS, FBI, ICE, and White House may reveal improper coordination to prevent state investigation and accountability.
CIVIL RIGHTS VIOLATIONS: A U.S. citizen was killed by a federal agent, and federal authorities are preventing independent investigation of potential civil rights violations.
UNDERMINING PUBLIC CONFIDENCE: Governor Walz stated 'it feels very, very difficult that we will get a fair outcome' given federal officials' pre-judgment of the case.
actions: Investigate DOJ's role in blocking state investigation
Investigate the legal basis for immunity claims
Investigate inter-agency communications regarding jurisdiction
Determine if DOJ personnel participated in obstruction
Preserve all records and evidence
Refer criminal conduct to appropriate authorities

background: Renee Nicole Good, 37-year-old U.S. citizen, poet, and mother of three, was shot and killed by ICE Agent Jonathan Ross in Minneapolis on January 7, 2026, after dropping her 6-year-old son at school.
Multiple videos show Good posed no threat. She smiled and said 'I'm not mad at you' moments before Ross fired three shots. Video shows Ross was standing out of her vehicle's path when he opened fire.
DHS Secretary Kristi Noem called Good's actions 'domestic terrorism.' Minneapolis Mayor Frey called that claim 'bullshit.' Governor Walz proclaimed January 9 'Renee Good Day.'
Federal authorities initially agreed to joint FBI-BCA investigation, then U.S. Attorney's Office 'reversed course' and seized exclusive jurisdiction.
Minnesota BCA has been blocked from all evidence: Agent Ross's firearm, cellphone video, ammunition casings, Good's vehicle, and all investigative interviews.
Minnesota AG Keith Ellison says federal immunity claims are 'misstatement of the law' and is pursuing independent investigation.
Rep. Robin Kelly (IL) filed articles of impeachment against DHS Secretary Noem on January 14, 2026.

Evidence at risk of suppression or destruction

High-level officials making false public statements about the incident
actions: Enter this matter into the Congressional Record
Initiate oversight hearings on the killing and federal obstruction

geraldo-lunas-campos.title: Geraldo Lunas Campos Case

geraldo-lunas-campos.background: On January 3, 2026, Geraldo Lunas Campos, a 55-year-old Cuban immigrant, died at Camp East Montana, a tent detention facility at Fort Bliss in El Paso, Texas. The medical examiner found asphyxia due to neck and chest compression and is expected to rule it a homicide. DHS claims he died during a suicide attempt. Witnesses say guards pinned and choked him.

keith-porter.title: Keith Porter Case
keith-porter.summary: Black father killed by off-duty ICE agent in LA on New Year's Eve. No bodycam, no witnesses confirm agent's account.
keith-porter.background: On December 31, 2025, Keith Porter Jr., a 43-year-old Black father, was shot and killed by an off-duty ICE agent at an apartment complex in Northridge, Los Angeles.
